parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From sun and ago; to lead together, i.e. Collect or convene; specially, to entertain.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.
From gramma. A writer, i.e. scribe or secretary.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a people.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To ask, inquire, ascertain by inquiry, understand.
Genitive case of an interrogative pronoun pos otherwise obsolete; as adverb of place; at what locality.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From a variation of genos; to procreate; figuratively, to regenerate.
